page.title: 08HANDS OFF OUR HOSPITAL!
page.content: In early 1985 the local hospital (built in 1935) in Edenbridge was threatened with closure due to its size and supposed uneconomic running costs, some of which, however, had always been met by a charitable group, The League of Friends. Local residents were faced with having to travel the twelve miles to Tunbridge Wells for hospital care. A meeting was held in February where The Tunbridge Wells Health Authority was questioned. Public support was so in favour of the hospital remaining open that it was agreed it would continue providing top line surgery provided consultants were prepared to travel to Edenbridge and local doctors would provide the necessary anaesthetics....by Clare Sharp & Susan Aylward.
